conclusion: A charged particle (mass m, charge +q) starts at origin O
It enters the magnetic field (4th quadrant) at a 45° angle to the y-axis
The magnetic field B is perpendicular to the plane, pointing inward
It then enters an electric field (1st quadrant) directed along negative y-axis
At point P(3L,L), its velocity is v_0 in the positive x-direction
We need to find the total travel time from O to P
In a magnetic field, a charged particle follows a circular path
Lorentz force causes circular motion with radius r = mv/qB
The arc length traveled in the magnetic field is πr/2
Time spent in the magnetic field is t_1 = πm/(2qB)
Coordinates where it crosses the x-axis is (r, 0)
x_1 = r = mv_i/qB
In the electric field, the particle experiences a force F = qE
Acceleration in the y-direction is a_y = qE/m
In the x-direction, there's no acceleration, so v_x = v_i
In the y-direction, v_y = -qE/m * t
Position equations: x = x_1 + v_i t, y = -1/2 * qE/m * t^2
At point P, v_y = 0 implies t_2 = 0, which is incorrect
Redefine: y-component of velocity reaches zero at P
L = 1/2 * qE/m * t_2^2, solving gives t_2 = sqrt(2mL/qE)
Horizontal displacement: 3L - x_1 = v_i t_2
v_i = (3L - mv_i/qB) / sqrt(2mL/qE)
At point P, v_x = v_0, so v_i = v_0
